description.@en: Once they were princes, with all their worldly wealth. Now, they are paupers, ready to sing for their supper.

effect.@en: After successfully casting this spell, select a number of allies or objects equal to your [WB]. The persons you see may hide any of their valuables, stored in a space outside of the Material Realm. The valuables they hide are up to them to decide. You can even make objects appear to be shabby or disguised as crumbs and trash; this is a helpful spell with which to hide contraband. Once the Duration of the spell ends, all valuables reappear.

criticalSuccess.@en: As above, but triple the Duration.

criticalFailure.@en: For a moment, all valuables you intended to hide disappear into the Ã†ther. A moment later, they return. However, three of the objects that were hidden will never be seen again. The GM will make the determination which of the objects do not reappear.

reagents.@en: A silken purse, turned inside out.

system.distance: Any persons or objects you can see
